clinical_study.brief_title: FAM-CAM Translation and Validation Into German
clinical_study.official_title: Translation and Validation of the Family Confusion Assessment Method (FAM-CAM) Into German for the Detection of Delirium in Critically Ill Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Validation and Translation of the Family Confusion Assessment Method (FAM-CAM) into German according to Principles of Good Practice for the Translation and Cultural Adaptation Process for Patient-Reported Outcomes of the International Society for Pharmaoeconomics and Outcome Research and comparison to CAM-ICU.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Errors in study conception, e.g. sample size calculation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: During a family visit which is not the first while treated in intensive care (an median of 10 days)
primary_outcome.description: Cohen's Kappa coefficient comparing the Family Confusion Assessment Method and the Confusion Assessment Method for Intensive Care Unit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During a family visit which is not the first while treated in intensive care (an median of 10 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Specificity of the Family Confusion Assessment Method in critically ill patients to detect Delirium

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During a family visit which is not the first while treated in intensive care (an median of 10 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity of the Family Confusion Assessment Method in critically ill patients to detect Delirium

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During a family visit which is not the first while treated in intensive care (an median of 10 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Negative Predictive Value of the Family Confusion Assessment Method in critically ill patients to detect Delirium

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During a family visit which is not the first while treated in intensive care (an median of 10 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Positive Predictive Value of the Family Confusion Assessment Method in critically ill patients to detect Delirium

arm_group.description: Critically ill patients with a RASS ≥ 3. FAM-CAM and CAM-ICU will be administered.

study_pop.textblock: Critically ill patients which are at risk for delirium and where assessing of delirium is not limited by language barriers.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Intensive Care Stay ≥ 48 hours
- Expected RASS ≥ 3
- Communication possible in German (minimum of C1 level of Common European Framework of Reference for Languages)
Exclusion Criteria:
- preexisting psychosis, dementia or depression
